status.description: Rocky Linux 8 Blueprint that assumes DHCP configuration, ejects CDROM, runs yum update, disables SELinux and initializes data disk. Sends out an email notification on successful creation of VM.

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    EjectCdrom
# description:  ejects all cdrom devices (/dev/sr*).               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

for device in /dev/sr*
do 
    sudo eject $device
    echo "Ejected ${device}"
done

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    UpdateRoot
# description:  updates root password with configured Calm credential secret.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: requires the root credential to be present in the blueprint.
# endregion
echo 'root:@@{root.secret}@@' | sudo chpasswd

#!/bin/bash # region headers # * author: stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com # * version: v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version # task_name: SendMail # description: sends an email notification to the Calm user including vm details. # output vars: none # dependencies: none # endregion sudo sed -i 's/MaxSessions 1/MaxSessions 10/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo sed -i 's/#Subsystem/Subsystem/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo /bin/systemctl restart sshd.service From=@@{email_sender}@@ To=@@{requester_email}@@ Subject="Your VM @@{vm_name}@@ is ready!" Body="

Hello @@{vm_requester_name}@@,

You had requested a Linux VM, we have successfully deployed your instance and you can start using it using the following informations:
Service type: Linux instance
Machine ip address: @@{address}@@
Instance name: @@{vm_name}@@
Login: @@{linux.username}@@
Password: none: using your private ssh key
For security reasons, please do not share your password or key with anyone.

Regards,

The Cloud Team

" echo " import email.message import smtplib server = smtplib.SMTP("\"@@{smtp_server}@@\"", 25) msg = email.message.Message() msg['Subject'] = "\"${Subject}\"" msg['From'] = "\"${From}\"" msg['To'] = "\"${To}\"" html_content="\"${Body}\"" msg.add_header('Content-Type', 'text/html') msg.set_payload(html_content) server.sendmail(msg['From'], [msg['To']], msg.as_string())" | tee ~/send_notification echo "Sending user notification" python ~/send_notification rm ~/send_notification

attrs.script:
# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    Restart
# description:  schedules a reboot 1 minute from now.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion
sudo shutdown --reboot 1

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
disable_root: False

hostname: @@{vm_name}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@.@@{domain}@@

users:
  - default
  - name: @@{linux.username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{public_key}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

runcmd:
  - [systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    DisableSelinux
# description:  disables enforcement of selinux policy.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname --static @@{vm_name}@@
echo "@@{address}@@  @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@ @@{vm_name}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
#sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo sed -i 's/SELINUX=enforcing/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InitializeDataDisk
# description:  configured /dev/sdb1 as an lvm volume, formats it
#               as ext4 and mounts it in /data, also configuring
#               fstab.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo yum install -y lvm2
printf 'o\nn\np\n\n\n\nt\n8e\nw' | sudo fdisk /dev/sdb
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb1
sudo vgcreate vg0 /dev/sdb1
sudo lvcreate -n data -l 100%FREE vg0
sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/vg0/data
sudo mkdir /data
sudo mount /dev/vg0/data /data
echo '/dev/mapper/vg0-data /data ext4 defaults 0 0' | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20221118 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InstallPython
# description:  installs python and defines default version.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo dnf install python39 -y
sudo alternatives --set python /usr/bin/python3.9
python --version

action_list.name: action_install

#!/bin/bash

#sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo sed -i 's/SELINUX=enforcing/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InitializeDataDisk
# description:  configured /dev/sdb1 as an lvm volume, formats it
#               as ext4 and mounts it in /data, also configuring

# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo yum install -y lvm2
printf 'o\nn\np\n\n\n\nt\n8e\nw' | sudo fdisk /dev/sdb
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb1
sudo vgcreate vg0 /dev/sdb1
sudo lvcreate -n data -l 100%FREE vg0
sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/vg0/data
sudo mkdir @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@
sudo mount /dev/vg0/data @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@
echo '/dev/mapper/vg0-data @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@ ext4 defaults 0 0' | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

status.name: nx-sb-cita-starter-lin-f1-AHV-c163123

spec.description: Rocky Linux 8 Blueprint that assumes DHCP configuration, ejects CDROM, runs yum update, disables SELinux and initializes data disk. Sends out an email notification on successful creation of VM.

action_list.description: System action for creating an application

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    EjectCdrom
# description:  ejects all cdrom devices (/dev/sr*).               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

for device in /dev/sr*
do 
    sudo eject $device
    echo "Ejected ${device}"
done

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    UpdateRoot
# description:  updates root password with configured Calm credential secret.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: requires the root credential to be present in the blueprint.
# endregion
echo 'root:@@{root.secret}@@' | sudo chpasswd

#!/bin/bash # region headers # * author: stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com # * version: v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version # task_name: SendMail # description: sends an email notification to the Calm user including vm details. # output vars: none # dependencies: none # endregion sudo sed -i 's/MaxSessions 1/MaxSessions 10/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo sed -i 's/#Subsystem/Subsystem/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo /bin/systemctl restart sshd.service From=@@{email_sender}@@ To=@@{requester_email}@@ Subject="Your VM @@{vm_name}@@ is ready!" Body="

Hello @@{vm_requester_name}@@,

You had requested a Linux VM, we have successfully deployed your instance and you can start using it using the following informations:
Service type: Linux instance
Machine ip address: @@{address}@@
Instance name: @@{vm_name}@@
Login: @@{linux.username}@@
Password: none: using your private ssh key
For security reasons, please do not share your password or key with anyone.

Regards,

The Cloud Team

" echo " import email.message import smtplib server = smtplib.SMTP("\"@@{smtp_server}@@\"", 25) msg = email.message.Message() msg['Subject'] = "\"${Subject}\"" msg['From'] = "\"${From}\"" msg['To'] = "\"${To}\"" html_content="\"${Body}\"" msg.add_header('Content-Type', 'text/html') msg.set_payload(html_content) server.sendmail(msg['From'], [msg['To']], msg.as_string())" | tee ~/send_notification echo "Sending user notification" python ~/send_notification rm ~/send_notification

action_list.name: action_create

action_list.description: System action for starting an application
action_list.name: action_start

action_list.description: System action for stopping an application
action_list.name: action_stop

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Deletes created VMs as well
action_list.name: action_delete

action_list.description: System action for restarting an application

attrs.script:
# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    Restart
# description:  schedules a reboot 1 minute from now.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion
sudo shutdown --reboot 1

action_list.name: action_restart

action_list.description: System action for deleting an application. Does not delete created VMs
action_list.name: action_soft_delete

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
disable_root: False

hostname: @@{vm_name}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@-@@{calm_array_index}@@.@@{domain}@@

users:
  - default
  - name: @@{linux.username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{public_key}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']

runcmd:
  - [systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

guest_customization.cloud_init:
#cloud-config
disable_root: False
hostname: @@{vm_name}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@
users:
  - default
  - name: @@{linux.username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
      - @@{public_key}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
runcmd:
  - [systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    DisableSelinux
# description:  disables enforcement of selinux policy.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname --static @@{vm_name}@@
echo "@@{address}@@  @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@ @@{vm_name}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
#sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo sed -i 's/SELINUX=enforcing/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InitializeDataDisk
# description:  configured /dev/sdb1 as an lvm volume, formats it
#               as ext4 and mounts it in /data, also configuring
#               fstab.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo yum install -y lvm2
printf 'o\nn\np\n\n\n\nt\n8e\nw' | sudo fdisk /dev/sdb
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb1
sudo vgcreate vg0 /dev/sdb1
sudo lvcreate -n data -l 100%FREE vg0
sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/vg0/data
sudo mkdir /data
sudo mount /dev/vg0/data /data
echo '/dev/mapper/vg0-data /data ext4 defaults 0 0' | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20221118 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InstallPython
# description:  installs python and defines default version.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo dnf install python39 -y
sudo alternatives --set python /usr/bin/python3.9
python --version

#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    DisableSelinux
# description:  disables enforcement of selinux policy.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname --static @@{vm_name}@@
echo "@@{address}@@  @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@ @@{vm_name}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
#sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo sed -i 's/SELINUX=enforcing/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InitializeDataDisk
# description:  configured /dev/sdb1 as an lvm volume, formats it
#               as ext4 and mounts it in /data, also configuring
#               fstab.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo yum install -y lvm2
printf 'o\nn\np\n\n\n\nt\n8e\nw' | sudo fdisk /dev/sdb
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb1
sudo vgcreate vg0 /dev/sdb1
sudo lvcreate -n data -l 100%FREE vg0
sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/vg0/data
sudo mkdir @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@
sudo mount /dev/vg0/data @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@
echo '/dev/mapper/vg0-data @@{data_volume_mount_point}@@ ext4 defaults 0 0' | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y
